column1: Recalculation of a pyroxene anlaysis (all Fe as FeO) and solving for Fe+3
This will also work for other minerals like garnet with fixed total cations, if the number of oxygens per formula is adjusted.
Replace the red analysis with your data
The sample analysis is an omphacite from a California eclogite (DHZ, 1963, v.2, p.156, #2)

column10: The "Sum" values are summations of the column of "Atom Units"
down to the element listed.  For example, "Sum Mg" would be the
sum of the "Atom Units" for Si, Ti, Al, Fe+3, Fe+2, Mn, and Mg.
The choice of "Sums" is based on cation sizes and site occupancies.
